oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Buffaloes at Glendale Park, Nashville, Tennessee, n.d.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An historic postcard picturing buffaloes grazing in the fields of the Old Glendale Park and Zoo, circa the early 20th century. This park, located approximately seven miles south of downtown Nashville, was one of the most popular excusions in town via the streetcar line. The park featured picnic grounds, band concerts, roller coaster rides, dance hall, skating rink and a zoo with alligators, buffalo, monkeys, sea lions, bears, buffaloes, and magnificent birds of plumage. Forms part of the Ridley Wills II Nashville Postcards Collection. 1 postcard.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Wills, Ridley, 1934-
